description:
This module produces UnboundLocalError when the ip is irregal.

This module should catch UnboundLocalError, and this module should raise  exception.InvalidCidr
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/virt/libvirt/netutils.py
title: virt.libvirt.netutils.py should handle  UnboundLocalError

comments.content:
This module produces UnboundLocalError when the ip is irregal.

This module should catch UnboundLocalError, and this module should raise  exception.InvalidCidr
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/virt/libvirt/netutils.py
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~nati-ueno

comments.content:
The relevant netutils bug is https://github.com/drkjam/netaddr/issues/6

It was fixed 2011/03/17, but fix has not been released.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mikeyp-3

comments.content: Since https://github.com/drkjam/netaddr/issues/6 has not been released for a while now, can we just add a try/catch in our code?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~dims-v

comments.content:
The following test:
    def test_get_net_and_mask_bad_ip_addr(self):
        cidr = '1.2.3.4/64'
        net, mask = netutils.get_net_and_mask(cidr)
        self.assertEquals(net, "1.2.3.4")
